Welcome to Genre Research Program’s documentation!¶

Butynets’ Danylo Python 3.8

class dictionary.Dict¶

Represent a custom dictionary.

keys()¶

(Dict) -> list Return list of Dict’s keys. :return: list

class dictionary.DictNode(key, value)¶

Represent a node in a Dict.

key()¶

Return the key of the node. :return: object

set_value(val)¶

Change the value of the node. :param val: object :return: None

value()¶

Return the value of the node. :return: object

Butynets’ Danylo Python 3.8

class linkedlist.Linked¶

Represent a linked list.

add(item)¶

(Linked, object) -> None Add a new item to the end of the linked list. :param item: object :return: None

head()¶

(Linked) -> LinkedNode or None Return head of the list. :return: LinkedNode or None

class linkedlist.LinkedNode(value)¶

Represent a node in linked list.

Butynets’ Danylo Python 3.8

class list.List(size)¶

Represent an array/list.

clear(value)¶

(List, object) -> None Set all the entries to the value.

Butynets’ Danylo Python 3.8

class music_adt.MusicADT(first_y, last_y, fullmode=False)¶

Represent MusicADT class and it operations it can perform.

basic_genre_in_year(year, genre)¶

Return the percentage popularity of the given genre in the given year. (only basic genres will have a result) :param year: int :param genre: str or list :return: tuple

fill_adt(f)¶

Fill the ADT corresponding to its time bounds. :return: None

get_whole_year(year)¶

Print info( position, author, track name) for every song in the year. :param year: int :return: None

graph()¶

If in fullmode, open browser page with all the data collected from the research in form of line graphic. :return: None

multiple_year_top(start_y, finish_y)¶

Print the most popular genre on the given timeline and its percentage. :param start_y: int :param finish_y: int :return: None

refactor_for_json()¶

Transforms the ADT into json compatible form. Used once when collecting the data using Spotipy and bs4. :return: None

track_search(track_name)¶

Print all the songs, whose track name contains your given string. :param track_name: str :return: None

years_top_genre(year)¶

Print the most popular genre of the given year and its percentage. :param year: int :return: None

Butynets’ Danylo Python 3.8

json_builder.create_json_data()¶

This function is used to create results.json, it runs for about 20 minutes and collects data from all the web-pages and uses it together with Spotipy to create a json file with all the info needed. (Info is stored as ADT and transformed into dict for json file) :return: None

json_builder.raw_year_top(year)¶

Parse through the the web-page and collect all the data necessary for using Spotify API (artists names and their songs). Different years have different HTML markdown. :param year: int :return: list

json_builder.rough_genre_generalization(genres)¶

(list) -> tuple or str Generalize all tracks genres to a single basic one, the list of basic genres is determined earlier in the source mentioned on the wiki page 0. :return: tuple or str

json_builder.song_clearer(name)¶

Return very simplified name of the artist, so that Spotipy could find him/her/them and his/her/their track with a higher chance. :param name: str :return: str

Butynets’ Danylo Python 3.8
